document.p: UPnP and NAT-PMP are two protocols that automatically create the port mappings needed by a device or application.
The following settings are available under UPnP on the WAN services:
document.li1:
UPnP Enabled:
Allows you to enable or disable UPnP.

NAT-PMP Enabled:
Allows you to enable or disable NAT-PMP.

Secure Mode Enabled:
In secure mode, a device or application can only create port mappings for itself.
document.p: Under UPnP you will also find a table that lists the current port mapping created via UPnP or NAT-PMP.
